metadata.title: CVE-2019-9928 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
GStreamer before 1.16.0 has a heap-based buffer overflow in the RTSPconnection parser via a crafted response from a server, potentiallyallowing remote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
gstreamer1.0-gl - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
libgstreamer-gl1.0-0 - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-base1.0 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.2').
